alert.note: Alert for Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:50AM EST until January 12 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Rancocas Creek At Pemberton affecting Burlington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is still occurring. * WHERE...North Branch Rancocas Creek at Pemberton. * WHEN...Until early this morning. * IMPACTS...At 2.5 feet, Some minor flooding begins in Eastampton along Rustic, Peninsula, and Paducah Roads. Lee Street, Joe Road, and Jill Court in Southampton also begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 2.5 feet. - Forecast...The river level will continue to slowly fall overnight and Friday. More rains are forecast for Friday night. Levels may rise again this weekend. - Flood stage is 2.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 2.5 feet on 08/24/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date North Branch Ran Pemberton 2.5 2.5 Fri 12 a 2.4 2.4 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued early this morning at 400 AM EST.
